c2d 0.0.9038

Hierarchize tags (fast)

Source: R/c2d.gen.R
hierarchize_tags_fast.Rd

Reconstructs the hierarchical relations between the three tag variables tags_tier_1, tags_tier_2 and tags_tier_3. Other than hierarchize_tags(), this function assumes that the three tag variables are always complete, i.e. that no (grand)parent tags of lower-tier tags are missing. This assumption is met by rfrnds() and rfrnd().

hierarchize_tags_fast(
  tags_tier_1 = character(),
  tags_tier_2 = character(),
  tags_tier_3 = character()
)

Arguments

tags_tier_1

First-tier tags. A character vector.
tags_tier_2

Second-tier tags. A character vector.
tags_tier_3

Third-tier tags. A character vector.

Value

A tibble with the columns tag_tier_1, tag_tier_2 and tag_tier_3.

See also

Other tag-related functions: data_tags, hierarchize_tags(), infer_tags(), tags()

Examples

library(magrittr)

c2d::rfrnd(id = "5bbbe26a92a21351232dd73f") %$%
  c2d:::hierarchize_tags_fast(unlist(tags_tier_1),
                              unlist(tags_tier_2),
                              unlist(tags_tier_3))
#> # A tibble: 3 × 3
#>   tag_tier_1         tag_tier_2   tag_tier_3                 
#>   <chr>              <chr>        <chr>                      
#> 1 state organisation federalism   intergovernmental relations
#> 2 state organisation legal system fundamental rights         
#> 3 public finance     taxation     tax system                 

# hierarchize the tags of all Austrian referendums
c2d::rfrnds(country_code = "AT") |>
  dplyr::group_split(id) |>
  purrr::map(~ c2d:::hierarchize_tags_fast(unlist(.x$tags_tier_1),
                                           unlist(.x$tags_tier_2),
                                           unlist(.x$tags_tier_3)))
#> [[1]]
#> # A tibble: 2 × 3
#>   tag_tier_1         tag_tier_2        tag_tier_3           
#>   <chr>              <chr>             <chr>
